div.p: Miss Ellen Smith.
111 Hatton Street.
Jackson,
Tenn.
Camp Meade Md
Dear Ellen -
Well how are you by this time? I am fine and dandy. and am learning to be a soldier fast. Friday I drilled for ten hours and I tell you I sure was tired when five oclock came

And yesterday I was in a dress parade for Secatary of War Baker and he complimented the 23 Engineers verry march Now just think of me marching in front of a man like him and I also got in the movies now you watch for the picture and when you see it pick out the bigest country boy in the bunch and say it me.
Well any way I am learning and ever body has to do that.
I sure wish I could be home for Xmas but there is no chance so I just wont think of such a thing and when you are having a good
time just think of me I dont think I will leave the camp at all.

I havent got all of my cloths yet they havent got some of the things I need they gave me a pair of shoes that look like same I wore when I was a kid out on the farm they are so heavy I count hardly work with them on but I guess I will have to stand it.
They will give me some more shoes when in am asigned to a company and I can go to town there I would be ashamed to let any one see me with this out fit on
Well what has happened in the city since I left that would sound good to me

Has Ester married yet I dont think she should leave you like that You wont have any one to be buddys with then I mean real close like her. I wonder if Everett made it ok on the 18 I supose he did I hope so any way

This is some fine Sunday afternoon and the bunch that came with me wants to go out for a walk so I guess I will have to go along We always have a bunch of visitors on Sundays Ladies and Gents from Washington and Baltimore we are 23 miles from Washington and 18 miles from Baltimore have street cars running to both places so when I get all dressed up some day I am going over to the big cities
Did Bob get his discharge if he wants it I hope he did and that is all the good I could do but dont love him to march
Well I will go and take my walk as I have told about all I know Wishing you a merry Xmas. I am as ever the same
James L.
Recruting Detachment 23 Engineers
Camp Meade Md
